parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Urrgh I cannot believe I have to count. - \|\|\^
Slide the picture back to the right a little, and set opacity to 0.
We're going to be doing this for every emote! Make sure to wait 20 frames
before the next dialogue or the pictures will insta-change rather than
Oh my gosh, what is going on? Is it Fathers arrival? \|\|\^
Is Haffenden under attack? I'd better go find the others and warn them! \|\|\^
\n<Leya> Thank the Gods I found you Cedric, what the
hell is going on? The bells just went off.
\n<Cedric> The city is under attack sister! Im not
sure who by I didnt recognize the sigil;
its not one of Lamar. However, we need to
find Richard, Idelle, Father and Mother.
\n<Leya> This is terrible although it is kind of exciting Ive
never experienced this before. I know Father and the
knights he travelled with were seen on the Long Walk
outside the city gates. I know brother is still in the
\n<Leya> East Courtyard. I just wanted to play hidenseek one
last time. We used to play it all the time when we were
younger before Richard and Idelle began their training.

Well with the market stalls stocked it should be able to get back on its feet. \|\|\^
Well you no longer need to worry, Lamar is free. \|\|\^
I am sure Mother and Father would be overjoyed to know. \|\|\^
Rinsar is the only other kingdom that isn't free. We need to go now. \|\|\^
I need to go see the Throne Room and that Priest before I go. I have to. \|\|\^
Would you like to save game?
\n<Lewis> Over the years I have noticed quite a few
strange things but the bay between Lamar
and Rinsar is really something else.
\n<Lewis> Well the waters are extremely shallow there.
Its so shallow that fishing cant be done.
Nor large ships cannot travel within the
bay as they fear they may get stuck.
\n<Cedric> That really is weird. I wonder why the bay
\n<Lewis> Well I did do a little bit of research to
find out exactly why. Luckily Lamar being
the oldest kingdom it had alot of knowledge
on the bay. Its believed that the bay is
\n<Lewis> the location of the kingdom of Istar before
the fall of Odaria. Istar was supposedly a
kingdom run by these so called magical beings
that we were so use to hearing about as a
\n<Lewis> child through bedtime stories. If this is
true it would explain Rinsars links to magic
being so close to the "magical kingdom".
\n<Cedric> If the kingdom of Istar was around until the
fall of Odaria why dont you just ask some of
the older locals who were around then they
might be able to tell you about it.
\n<Virginia> The lifestyle surely has changed rapidly
since the Haffendens were overthrown by the
\n<Virginia> Well now the streets are constantly patrolled.
If you step out of line the punishment is
immediately death. Im sure you've noticed
the drop in population. I dont think it will
\n<Virginia> be as good as it use to be for a long time.
\n<Cedric> Yes it will. We will find a way to overcome
\n<Virginia> I have to say I do love your confidence it
\n<Rosa> What is harder to catch the faster you run?
\n<Rosa> Correct I guess it would help to have alot
\n<Rosa> Your a bit boring arent you.
\n<Wanda> Oh, my Lord were under attack! You should
\n<Albion> Run! Its an attack maybe the Randalls turned on us!

\n<Carlyle Port>Lord Cedric, we have a serious problem
\n<Carlyle Port>Yes! I have been informed of illegal trade
taking place in Haffenden. People are
actively breaking the law to make money.
\n<Cedric>Really? Well if this is true, you're right
we cant let it slide. It could lead to a
\n<Carlyle Port>What should we do about it?
\n<Cedric>Leave it to me, I will look into it.
\n<Carlyle Port>People actively breaking the law can lead
\n<Carlyle Port>Lord Cedric did you sort it out?
\n<Cedric>Yes I did, however remain vigilant I
\n<Carlyle Port>Yes my Lord, I will be.
